data.title: Linea del tiempo Michael Jordan Jesus Valeria
data.text:
1966

The Jordan family moves to Wilmington, North Carolina.

1978

Jordan joins the basketball team at Emsley A. Laney High School in Wilmington.

1979

Jordan begins his college career at the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill.

1982

Jordan makes an iconic shot in the NCAA Championship final against Georgetown, securing the victory for North Carolina.

1984

Selected as the third overall pick in the NBA Draft by the Chicago Bulls.

1985

Jordan is named NBA Rookie of the Year.

1986

Jordan scores 63 points in a single playoff game against the Boston Celtics.

1963

Michael Jeffrey Jordan is born in Brooklyn, New York, becoming one of the greatest basketball players of all time.

Michael Jeffrey Jordan

Full Name: Michael Jeffrey JordanPlace of Birth: Brooklyn, New York, USADate of Birth: February 17, 1963Category: Sports

1988

Wins his first NBA MVP award and leads the Bulls to the NBA Finals for the first time in his career.

1989

Jordan is chosen as NBA Most Valuable Player and leads the Bulls to the NBA Finals once again.

1991

The Bulls win their first NBA championship, with Jordan being named Finals MVP.

1992

Wins his second consecutive NBA championship and is named Finals MVP for the second time.

1993

The Bulls win their third consecutive NBA championship, with Jordan being named Finals MVP for the third time.

1994

Jordan announces his retirement from professional basketball.

1995

Jordan returns to the Bulls and leads the team to another NBA Finals victory, being named Finals MVP for the fourth time.

1987

Leads the NBA in scoring and is selected as the All-Star Game MVP.

Michael Jeffrey Jordan

Full Name: Michael Jeffrey JordanPlace of Birth: Brooklyn, New York, USADate of Birth: February 17, 1963Category: Sports

1997

The Bulls win their fifth NBA championship, with Jordan being named Finals MVP for the sixth time.

1998

The Bulls win their sixth NBA championship, with Jordan being named Finals MVP for the seventh time.

1999

Jordan announces his second retirement from professional basketball.

2001

Jordan joins the Washington Wizards as President of Basketball Operations and a player.

2003

Jordan announces his third and final retirement from professional basketball.

2006

Jordan becomes the first former NBA player to own an NBA team, the Charlotte Bobcats (now known as the Charlotte Hornets).

2010

Jordan is inducted into the NBA Basketball Hall of Fame.

Michael Jeffrey Jordan

1996

The Bulls win their fourth NBA championship, with Jordan being named Finals MVP for the fifth time.

Full Name: Michael Jeffrey JordanPlace of Birth: Brooklyn, New York, USADate of Birth: February 17, 1963Category: Sports

2014

Jordan becomes the first NBA billionaire thanks to his investments and endorsement deals.
